Reviews.Title: “Perfectly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dougiet33
Reviews.Content: Big bed, cable TV, car park, affordable and a good location in Hollywood area. Easy to get to off the freeway and to travel around the local area. Much cheaper than some other accommodation in the area. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Decent”
Reviews.Author: checkerspot
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of the other posters, I was surprised at the amount of deposits and the overall school marm authoritarian rule of the place. I understand they must have been burned in the past and they're trying to avoid hookers and partying and drugs on the premises, but some of us are just good, normal people who need an inexpensive place to stay. I hate the idea of the doors locking at 7pm or whenever it is so you have to buzz the owner to get back in. The no visitors rule had me scared to death even for my friend to come pick me up. And the maid was so weird and suspicious about me asking for an extra towel, I didn’t even bother after that. Just a note: For what they're charging per night ($80 something), it is not worth it at all - there are comparable places in Hollywood that are much nicer. The weekly rate is $340 and very worth it, if you need a cheap place to stay and you have very basic standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very strange!!!”
Reviews.Author: txbyrdman
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to have to leave a deposit for a room key and tv remote. The rooms were not very clean, carpet dirty, hot water was only warm not hot. Not the best neighbourhood. Not the worst but certainly not even close to the best.

Reviews.Title: “I can't explain this place in one sentence.”
Reviews.Author: tobeperfectlyhonest
Reviews.Content: An older Indian couple run and own this hotel. They are fairly nice people but not totally assimilated into American culture. Understanding this would probably help you enjoy your stay here. If you need a cheap place to stay in Hollywood I would say this place is as good as it gets. There is no pool, it is somewhat close to the freeway, there is no real social space, but, the staff is good at what they do, the rules more or less make sense for the clientele and the area (they don't allow visitors etc.), and the location is very central. They also don't have fridges, they should get those... Anyways, it's got pluses and minuses but for the price it is an overall keeper. In response to the previous post, I would say that the management is pretty laid back so long as you play by their rules, and realize there is a reason why the world has the word "ugly americans", because we come from a presumptous culture. I digress... ... good wifi.

Reviews.Title: “very cleany, but u need to stay almost 1 week”
Reviews.Author: ziamelaloon
Reviews.Content: We stay there only 3 days, and we spent 300 $, high price for this hotel, but if u ca stay there for 1 week they will apply 50% off so 1 week will cost only 350$. Very clean, comforteble beds, and nice people are working there. wi-fi included Only few steps from the vine/hollywood station.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of weird”
Reviews.Author: Lost_Weekenders
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was two blocks from family, which was nice because we didn't have to "hang out" in our room. It's perfectly fine if you just need a place to crash. But they required deposits for everything - for example the remote and the *room card*! If you do stay, do yourself a favor and go explore Franklin Blvd. See the Citizen's Brigade, have coffee at Bourgeois Pig, and beers at the Birds. Shoot, you'd probably have a better time at the grocery store than in your room...

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I needed.”
Reviews.Author: eyrelight
Reviews.Content: I had a very positive experience at this hotel. My friend that I was visiting lived across the street so I stayed here only by chance. Awesome location right in the middle of Hollywood. Walking distance from the UCB Theatre, Prizzi's Pizza, Birds, Gelson's Supermarket and other cool hangouts with good food. I felt extremely welcome and I even came in late a few times without being made to feel guilty(you have to be buzzed in after dark). The staff(most of which seem to be an Indian family which live inside of the hotel) were very warm and always greeted me with a hello and smile as I was going to and fro. Very safe area, it's across the street from a school and there are signs indicating that the area is a "Safe School Zone" with higher penalties for committing crimes. My room was incredibly clean and equipped with an effective air conditioner. Housekeeping came in every day in the early afternoon to do a very thorough cleaning job. My only unpleasant experience was when they came in before noon when I really, really wanted to sleep in. But other than that, I couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Did not feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: jessiesweigart
Reviews.Content: The place is fine. Rooms are clean and basic. Location is fine, Next to the 101 fwy and located at the base of the Hollywood Hills. The problem is the managers are not very welcoming. We went there because of the location and got treated like we were intuders. When we came back late one night, the owner (or manager) had to be woken up and came out sleepy eyed to buzz us in. We didn't want to leave again, even though we were going to a party, which is the main reason for the trip. When we came back later, he could not have been more annoyed with us. Between the inch thick bullet-proof glass and feeling like prisoners, I think we'll stay somewhere else next time. Jessica

Reviews.Title: “a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: starbucks25
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and had a nice bed, clean bathroom, close the 101 fwy, which was fine, not too noisy and located in a nice neighborhood in Hollywood, close to "Hollywood", but in a more suburban neighborhood. The problem was: I paid $114.00 per night because the only remaining room had a kitchen. The "kitchen" was a mini fridge and a microwave. The manager or owner, David was nice enough, but I felt like a criminal staying there. I had to pay a $20 deposit for the tv remote, like I would steal a $5 remote, so I have to put $20 down to ensure that won't happen. Also, I was staying by myself, but had a friend in town, and when I tried to bring her to the room just to grab some stuff, so we could go out for the night, he actually tried to charge me $5 for her to come into the room!!! Why not $20? After all, she might steal the remote. I was so offended I told him I would not pay the $5 (out of principle) and he told me I had to pay it or I could not stay there. I paid the $5, which I wish I hadn't, and just gone somewhere else, but I didn't. I understand you're in Hollywood, where there are some criminals, but I can find a place in the same neighborhood that doesn't think I'm one. You have to have better judgment than that. That whole experience ruined it for me. Next time I'm in town for business, I'll go to the Best Western, two blocks away. Mike Moore

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: LittleGreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed the La Mirage this past weekend and had a very good experience. It is an excellent value. Our first choice was the Best Western down the street, but it was booked (and $70 more per night). La Mirage is a bare bones hotel, but very clean. Bring your own shampoo - they don't provide it. They didn't have a crib for our baby so we had to bring one which was no big deal. I was a little worried about staying there but on the strength of the few reviews I read here, I decided it was worth trying. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nestled in the Beachwood section of Hollywood the Mirage Inn is an excellent place to stay while in the area. A family owned operation where each guest is treated like a member of the family. Rooms are large, clean and neat. The Beachwood area has everything you need and is a short walk from downtown Hollywood. I highly recommend the Mirage Inn to anyone staying in the the Los Angeles area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the weekly rate”
Reviews.Author: deb18
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during the week of July 4th. For the price, I think it was a very good place to stay. Not having seen many reviews on the net, we went there with trepidation. We found the place to be clean, safe, they locked the doors during the evening and night and would ring you in, and the management was responsive. One night a guest made a distrbance at 4 am and he would not calm down. The following day he was evicted. The room did have airconditioning and because the room faced Franklin Ave we did use it at night. It was very convenient, we walked to downtown Hollywood (it was a good hike) and also took the dash. It was close to cafe 101 to get coffee, but I do wish they had coffee in the room. I would stay there again in a heart beat. I have read about other Høllywood hotels that were dirty, buggy, and had questionable people around them, and I did not find that at all with this hotel. Ask for the weekly rate if you are staying there for a week or more. It is a bargain. It is not a fancy place, but it is clean and safe.

HotelInfo.Name: La Mirage Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 6020 Franklin Ave., Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
